results.title: Arabian children
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The life of a family living on a farm in Saahab in TransJordan. Describes the events of a typical day and shows the children minding sheep, working in the fields and in the house, going to school and visiting a nearby village. It also emphasises the importance of water and the camel to their way of life.

results.title: Arabella
results.creator_credit: John Cox, John Vernon, BBC-TV and Glyndebourne
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne is renowned for its opera productions and has proven once again, with its choice of Arabella for their Golden Jubilee season, of its high standards and professionalism. A romantic comedy in three acts with music by Richard Strauss and libretto by Hugo von Hofmannsthal, the story of Arabella focuses on a Viennese family, Count Waldner (Artur Korn), his wife Adelaide (Regina Sarfaty) and two daughters, Arabella (Ashley Putnam) and Zdenka (Gianna Rolandi) who live in genteel poverty. Arabella has several suitors but on meeting Mandryka (John Brocheler), a rich landowner, it is love at first sight. Meanwhile Zdenka falls in love with Matteo (Keith Lewis), one of Arabella’s suitors and causes great confusion when she sends Matteo a love letter under Arabella’s name. Intrigue and misunderstanding follow delaying the anticipated happy ending. Strauss’s beautiful waltz music is performed by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, led by David Nolan, conducted by Bernard Haitink, and the Glyndebourne Chorus led by Chorus director Jane Glover. The stylishly authentic stage sets are designed by Julia Trevelyan Oman. Both Ashley Putnam and John Brocheler put in an impressive performance along with their support cast with a special mention to Gwendolyn Bradley in the role of Die Fiakermilli. Produced by BBC Television by arrangement with Glyndebourne in association with RM Arts. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Contains a booklet with both German and English translation.

results.title: Arab identity: who are the Arabs? (Episode 1)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the diversity of one hundred and twenty-five million Arabs and the unifying power of their heritage. Shows the force of the Islamic faith as pilgrims throng to Mecca’s Great Mosque. Shows that four hundred miles to the North, Arab traditions are dying under political and Western influence.

results.title: Aquatica
results.brief_description: ‘George Rolfe’s ‘Aquatica’ conveys the epic grandeur that the 3D medium is capable of. His vision of vast futuristic cities is simply not possible in film ‘ it can only be done in 3D animation. George’s piece has no narrative, but is connected by the theme of water ‘ life above it, and life below it. He has an amazing eye for cinematography, and with relatively simple models has effectively conveyed the scope of massive landscapes and titanic struggles. Key to the piece are the camera movements, and the star of the show is the water, which is exceptional ‘ sparkling, reflective, and in constant motion. It’s a work of sophistication and maturity.Judges comment diegesis 2002

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

group_siblings.title: A Life before
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jamie MacDowell, Jim Curtis and Nick Ball

results.title: Aquatic wizards
results.brief_description: A short 50s newsreel with a light-hearted commentary, filmed at Cyprus Gardens in Florida, featuring male and female bathing beauties demonstrating a selection of water skiing styles. Begins with groups of young boys and girls learning to ski, followed by examples of the different types of skis. The films proceeds to adult skiers such as champion Alfredo Medoza (also referred to as the Mexican Jumping Bean) demonstrating a variety of jumps. Also features champion and innovative skier Willa McGuire performing the technique she originated known as swivel skiing, combining ballet with water skiing.

results.title: Aquarius: solo for 2 people
results.brief_description: Shows how a short ballet style dance performance evolves beginning with the dancer, Sandra Craig, meeting the composer. The film then shows the collaboration between Sandra, the composer, the director/choreographer and finally the male dancer as they create the final product.

results.title: Aquarium wonderland
results.brief_description: In microscopic and unusual close-up scenes and animation, we see how fish breathe, hear, feel, smell and swim. A boy shows how to set up and maintain an aquarium, using the proper amount of water, plants and food for the goldfish and other animal life it contains.

results.title: Aquarium
results.brief_description: Brilliantly photographed non-narrated tableau of unusual underwater creatures including fish that walk on their ‘hands’, sea horses and octopus. Explores the feeding habits and methods of locomotion of these marine life forms. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Aptitudes and occupations: an introduction to vocational guidance
results.brief_description: Discusses six of the fundamental human aptitudes: social, mechanical, clerical, musical, artistic and scholastic; and indicates how a student may, with the help of an educational or vocational counsellor, determine in which of these aptitudes they are most gifted. Indicates the broad fields of employment in which certain combinations of abilities are required. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.
